definition: theater chain (abbr. for 電影院線|电影院线)
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)

sentences.english: Now it appears it has a studio that will get it into theaters.
sentences.chinese: 现在看来已经有制片厂愿意把它推广到院线。

sentences.english: What will be the next global cinematic hot spot?
sentences.chinese: 全球院线的下个热门点又将是什么？

sentences.english: Compared to the same weekend last year, business was up 59 percent.
sentences.chinese: 相比于去年同期的周末，院线票房大增59%。

definition: to premiere (a movie or TV show)/premiere (of a movie)/first-run (movie)/to greet (the eye) before anything else (e.g. when entering a room)
slot within a schedule/timeslot (for a TV program, a session with a photographer etc)/range of dates in which an event is to be held (film screening, exhibition etc)
to start shooting (a film)/to invest in (a movie)/to put (sth) up for auction
